alert.note: Alert for Coastal Miami Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 1:42PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Miami-Dade County through 215 PM EDT... At 142 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm over University Park, or near Kendall, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Miami, Coral Gables, South Miami, Kendall, Pinecrest, Sweetwater, West Miami, Westchester, Glenvar Heights, Richmond West, Fountainbleau, Richmond Heights, Country Walk, Kendale Lakes, Zoo Miami, The Hammocks, Coral Terrace, Olympia Heights, West Kendall and Intersection Krome And Kendall Drive. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Miami Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metropolitan Miami Dade
